result.execSummary:
The defendant James M Steger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--any rules at the group home are also rules of Mr. Steger's probation 

--continue with all recommended mental health treatment. 

--take all prescription drugs as prescribed

--any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per agent

-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
 
--ARRESTING AGENCY : JEFFERSON PD

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James M Steger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:53pm [mo]
Defendant James M Steger in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--any rules at the group home are also rules of Mr. Steger's probation 

The Court adopts all other conditions as set forth in the Criminal Case Settlement.

[which are:
--continue with all recommended mental health treatment. 
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--to pay statutory costs]


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The Court does not order a DNA sample. 
recess:4:11pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case called at 3:19 pm [sf]
Defendant James M Steger in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived of penalties and factual basis
Court verifies DOB and address with the defendant.
Court reviews criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence

off record for scheduling: 3:22 pm
reconvene: 3:22 pm

recess: 3:23 pm
